newsitem.title: USA: CSCE coffee spikes up on spec, trade buying.
newsitem.headline: CSCE coffee spikes up on spec, trade buying.

text.p: CSCE coffee futures rose sharply Monday afternoon, as speculative and trade buying drove the September contract through key resistance and touched off buy stops, dealers said.
"September broke 184.50 (cents per lb) -- the double top -- so people like it," said one trader.
At 1308 EDT, September arabicas jumped 11.20 cents, to 187.50 cents, after peaking at 189.00. Second-month December was 6.75 higher, at 164.00, while the remaining months rose 2.50 to 6.00.

Coffee prices headed higher from the opening bell, gapping up more than a cent, on light local and speculative interest. Up to midday, the September contract held below 184.50 resistance, but an afternoon rally breached resistance, triggering buy-stops and driving prices quickly toward highs.

Fundamentally. although no fresh news emerged today, dealers said concerns there may be a shortage of exchange-certified coffee stocks for delivery against the September contract continued to fuel buying.
On the charts, September's next resistance level was seen at 192.00-193.00 cents, traders said.
Volume as of 1200 EDT was thin, at an estimated 2,212 lots.
